intro: Pouteria dies-reginae, commonly known as the royal pouteria, is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its large, elliptical leaves and showy yellow flowers. The tree produces edible fruits that are typically harvested when they turn a deep red or orange color. Its wood is valued for its durability and is used in various crafts and construction. The plant also has cultural significance in some regions where it is used in traditional medicine.
